newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.African Comair starts Cape Town-Windhoek flights.
newsitem.headline: S.African Comair starts Cape Town-Windhoek flights.

text.p: Comair, South Africa's largest independent airline, said on Thursday it would inaugurate two return flights weekly between Cape Town and Windhoek, with Saturday and Sunday schedules, from October 1.

The airline will also be introducing new flights to Port Elizabeth from Johannesburg, Cape Town and Durban, and introducing two flights weekly between Johannesburg and Zimbabwe's Victoria Falls from the same date, lifting total weekly flights to 340.
Comair signed a franchise agreement with British Airways Plc in June under which its aircraft will use the BA name and livery from October 27.
